Description: Fragmentary conical hair-net of undyed linen which is now straw-coloured to dark brown; patterned with lozenges produced by areas of dense and less dense netting; the hair-het is drawn into the central point by increasing the grouping together of the individual threads; part of both sides of the opening preserved with, on one side of a seam, a solid edge formed by two cords passing through short loops and, on other side, longer loops; the draw string now missing; a lock of human hair is preserved in the most matted area; warp-linen (S spun Z ply/c.12); two selvedges and parts of two looped ends; two seams, overcast with linen thread (S spun Z ply)
Curator's comments: see HG-T card Information from Hero Granger-Taylor (date unknown) C14 dating: (BM21640) : 1225±25BP 68.2% probability: 750AD (68.2%) 900AD 95.4% probability: 650AD (95.4%) 900AD
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
